div.em: Current conditions as of 22 Apr 08:35 am CDT

div.div: Showers likely, mainly after 4pm. Increasing clouds, with a high near 68. South wind 6 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%.
Showers. Low around 52. Southeast wind 5 to 13 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%.
Showers likely, mainly before noon. Cloudy, with a high near 65. Northeast wind 7 to 14 mph becoming northwest in the morning. Winds could gust as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%.

div.p: Working...

img.alt: online resources with app icons coming from book

div.p: During the closure, we want to offer as many learning opportunities as possible. For families that have internet access, below you will find some links to online options.PLEASE CHECK BACK OFTEN, RESOURCES WILL BE ADDED AS QUICKLY AS POSSIBLE!

Mrs. Britton's Online Resources - Students in 6th - 8th grade were provided an information sheet on the items on this resource tab. Some of the resources may require a student set up an account. Please have them use their home email and school login and password.This login would be gradyear first initial last name (20jdoe for 8th graders, 21jdoe for 7th graders, and so on).
The resources include
Mrs. Miller's Message and Lesson - Click here to download a pdf of Mrs. Miller's message
Crayola DYI Crafts - lots of crafts you can do at home
Speech Resources - 6 Free Online Speech Therapy Resources For Kids
Author Sites - Many authors are making their works available to students, including read alouds, demo drawings, and games.
Oliver Jeffers - www.oliverjeffers.com
Kate Messner - www.katemessner.com
Debbie Ridpath Ohi - www.debbieohi.com
Storyline Online - www.storylineonline.net
Jarrett J Krosoczka www.studiojjk.com
Jarrett Lerner www.jarrettlerner.com
Mo Willems - https://www.kennedy-center.org/education/mo-willems/
Melissa Stewart - www.melissa-stewart.com
James Dashner - www.jamesdashner.com
Scholastic - Day-by-day projects to keep kids reading, thinking, and growing.

LunchDoodle - Mo Willems invites YOU into his studio every day for his LUNCH DOODLE. Learners worldwide can draw, doodle and explore new ways of writing by visiting Mo’s studio virtually once a day for the next few weeks.
Draw Everyday with JKK - JarJarrett J. Krosoczka—author & illustrator is going live every weekday at 1pm Central Time for at least the next few weeks.
Wonderopolis - Wonderopolis is filled with a million answer to the questions that kids want answered.
Invent It Challenge - Create a new invention that helps provide access to healthy food for everyone, everywhere, every day.

Discovery Challenge - The 2020 TCS' Ignite Innovation Student Challenge is now open! See details below for how to participate and share ideas for digital solutions that improve the world for a chance to win up to a $10,000 scholarship, virtual mentorship, and more.

At Home Science Lessons - These 63 science experiments for kids are super-easy and a lot of fun to boot, as kids are exposed to a wide variety of scientific concepts. It's a great way to spend quality time together as a family and who knows, mom and dad may end up learning a new thing or two, too.
Join Missouri House Communications for a virtual tour of the dome of the State Capitol in Jefferson City. - https://youtu.be/S_cTCd2D6b8
Stained glass, murals, carvings and statuary shows Missouri’s history. - https://www.pbs.org/video/opt-documentaries-stately-images-public-art-missouris-state-capitol
